page.title: 07Horticultural Fete,Marchwood
page.content: Marchwood has had a horticultural fete annually since 1923.It has games, stalls and competitions.Years ago they used to 'bowl for a pig'.You had to roll a ball at some skittles.At the end of the day the person who had knocked the most skittles down won the pig.In those days a pig was worth a lot of money. After each fete all the profits went to the church and school funds.Games were always there and still are today.'Put the ball in the hole' games were quite popular.Small balls were rolled across a board to miss or go down holes.Competitions often involved aiming or shooting at goals. It all started as just a horticultural show,but now it is the main social event in the village and it is still going strong.
